flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click][Click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Haas Arcology AI

flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
title: Thomas Haas

text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
title: Bioroid Efficiency Research

flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[Credits].
title: Successful Demonstration

flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
text:
The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Heimdall 2.0

flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru
text: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
title: Howler

flavor: The game has changed.
text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
title: Ichi 2.0

flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
text: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
title: Minelayer

text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Viktor 2.0

flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
title: Zed 1.0

text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
title: Awakening Center

text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [Trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
title: Tyr's Hand

flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3[Credits].
title: Gila Hands Arcology

flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
text: [Click], 1[Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Levy University

flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
text:
Gain 2[Credits] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
title: Server Diagnostics

flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
text: [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Bastion

flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Datapike

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge

flavor: "I can make that work."
text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
title: Exile: Streethawk

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
title: Escher

flavor: Wheeeee!
text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
title: Exploratory Romp

flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[Credits] for each program trashed.
title: Freelance Coding Contract

flavor: One man's trash.
text:
As an additional cost to play this card, trash an installed program.
Install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
title: Scavenge

flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
title: Levy AR Lab Access

text: +3[Memory Unit] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[Credits]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Monolith

flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
text:
3[Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
title: Feedback Filter

flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
text: [Trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
title: Clone Chip

text:
Omni-Drive can host a single program of 1[Memory Unit] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
title: Omni-Drive

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[Credits] to put X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
title: Atman

flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
title: Cloak

flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
title: Dagger

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
title: Chakana

text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.
title: Cyber-Cypher

flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash assets.
title: Paricia

flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." - The Professor
text: 2[Credits], [Trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
title: Self-modifying Code

flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
title: Sahasrara

flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Inti

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig his, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
text: [Click]: Gain 1[Credits] and draw 1 card.
title: Professional Contacts

flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
text:
+1[Link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
title: Borrowed Satellite

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[Credits] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
title: Ice Analyzer

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[Credits] if it was successful.
title: Dirty Laundry

flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[Credits] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
title: Daily Casts

flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
text: [Click], [Click], [Trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
title: Same Old Thing

flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[Credits].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
title: The Source

flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
title: Frame Job

text: [Click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs.
title: Pawn

text: [Click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.
title: Rook

text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
title: Hostage

flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
text:
Whenever the corp spends a [Click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[Credits] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 1[Credits] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
title: Gorman Drip v1

flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
title: Lockpick

flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
title: False Echo

flavor: Normal people–sane people–do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
title: Motivation

flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
title: John Masanori

flavor: Who wants to start a war?
text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
title: Project Ares

flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [Subroutine] End the run.
title: NEXT Bronze

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[Credits] for each card revealed.
title: Celebrity Gift

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
text:
1[Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Himitsu-Bako

flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor
text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
title: Character Assassination

flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.
title: Jackson Howard

text: As additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Trace2– If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
title: Invasion of Privacy

flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
title: Geothermal Fracking

text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[Credits]." for each advancement token on it.
title: Swarm

flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?
text: Purge virus counters.
title: Cyberdex Trial

flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
title: Grim

text: [Click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.
title: Bishop

flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[Credits].
title: Scheherazade

flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.
text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] and lose [Click].
title: Hard at Work

flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.
text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
title: Recon

flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.
text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).
title: Copycat

flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking
text: 3[Credits]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
title: Leviathan

flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[Credits], if able; otherwise, trash it.
title: Eureka!

flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor
text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
title: Record Reconstructor

flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to play events.
title: Prepaid VoicePAD

text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [Click][Click].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.
title: Wotan

text: Play only if the Runner installed a resource on his or her last turn. Trace2– If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
title: Hellion Alpha Test

flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthenasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
title: Clone Retirement

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [Subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Swordsman

flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
title: Shipment from SanSan

text: When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
title: Muckraker

flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
title: The Cleaners

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [Click], [Trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
title: Elizabeth Mills

text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server. 
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
title: Off the Grid

flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[Credits] for each bad publicity taken.
title: Profiteering

flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
text: Gain 15[Credits].
title: Restructure

flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

text: +3[Memory Unit] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [Click] ability without spending [Click]. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Deep Red

flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
text: 2[Credits]: Break subroutine on host ice. [Click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
title: Knight

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
title: Running Interference

flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
text: [Click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
title: Expert Schedule Analyzer

flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.
text: When you turn ends, gain 1[Credits] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
title: Grifter

flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Torch

flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
title: Woman in the Red Dress

flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[Trash]: Expose 1 card.
title: Raymond Flint

flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
text: [Click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
title: Isabel McGuire

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
title: Hudson 1.0

flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
title: Accelerated Diagnostics

text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
title: Unorthodox Predictions

flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1 [Click] on his or her turn, gain 2[Credits] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.
title: Sundew

flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[Credits].
title: City Surveillance

text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
title: Snoop

flavor: Say it really fast.
text: Ireress gains "[Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits]" for each bad publicity you have.
title: Ireress

text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.
title: Power Shutdown

flavor: It folds under pressure.
text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Paper Wall

flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
title: Interns

flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
text: [Click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.
title: Keyhole

flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja
text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.
title: Activist Support

flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.
title: Lawyer Up

flavor: "Care to have a look?"
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
title: Leverage

flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.
text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Garrote

flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"
text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.
title: LLDS Processor

flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
text: [Trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[Credits]: +2 strength.
title: Sharpshooter

flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor
text: [Click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.
title: Capstone

flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."
text: When your turn begins, lose [Click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.
title: Starlight Crusade Funding

text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[Credits].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
title: Rex Campaign

flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.
text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Fenris

flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.
text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[Credits]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
title: Panic Button

text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.
title: Shock!

flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Tsurugi

flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
title: TGTBT

flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
text: Gain 1[Credits] for each card in the Runner's grip.
title: Sweeps Week

flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.
text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
title: RSVP

flavor:
[Subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Curtain Wall

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
text: Trace5– If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
title: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.
text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
title: Veterans Program

flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card (non-ice).
title: Quest Completed

flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [Click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
title: Hemorrhage

flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [Trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
title: Tallie Perrault

flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.
title: Executive Wiretaps

flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.
text: +2[Memory Unit] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Blackguard

flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: +2[Memory Unit]
title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

flavor: The beginning…
text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
title: Alpha

flavor: …and the end?
text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
USe Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
title: Omega

text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.
title: Blackmail

flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].

Gain 5[Credits] and draw 2 cards.
title: Blue Level Clearance

text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [Click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
title: Strongbox

text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
title: Toshiyuki Sakai

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Yagura

flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
title: Restoring Face

text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
title: Market Research

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Wraparound

flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
text: You start the game with 10[Credits] and 1 bad publicity.
title: GRNDL: Power Unleashed

flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad pûblicity.
title: Vulcan Coverup

flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 4[Credits] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
title: GRNDL Refinery

text:
Gain 1[Credits]. Gain [Click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
title: Subliminal Messaging

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).
title: Singularity

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
title: Queen's Gambit

flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori
text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
title: Dyson Fractal Generator

flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
title: Silencer

flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago
text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[Credits]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
title: Savoir-faire

flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
text:
[Trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits].
title: Fall Guy

flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory
text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Gain 2[Credits]. Gain an additional 1[Credits] for each double event in your heap.
title: Power Nap

flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: [Click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
title: Paintbrush

flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Gain 9[Credits].
title: Lucky Find

flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
text: [Subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the start of the Corp's next turn.
title: Gyri Labyrinth

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
title: Reclamation Order

flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.
text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, trace3– if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
title: Broadcast Square

flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Begin replaced by an android.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
title: Corporate Shuffle

flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
title: Caprice Nisei

text: When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, do 2 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
title: Shinobi

flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
title: Marker

text:
Hive loses an "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Hive

flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
title: Witness Tampering

text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[Credits].
title: NAPD Contract

flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
text: [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Quandary

flavor: Evolving a Better You.
text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer

flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.
text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[Credits].
title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation

text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within

text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
title: House of Knives

flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
title: Medical Breakthrough

text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
title: Philotic Entanglement

text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
title: The Future Perfect

text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
title: Chairman Hiro

flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
text:
Gain 1[Credits] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
title: Mental Health Clinic

text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
title: Psychic Field

text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[Credits]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth −1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
title: Shi.Kyū

flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
text: [Click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
title: Tenma Line

text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
title: Cerebral Cast

flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease–of bioterrorism–demands that we continue our efforts."
text: Gain 8[Credits]. The Runner gains 3[Credits].
title: Medical Research Fundraiser

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
title: Mushin No Shin

flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
title: Inazuma

text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
title: Komainu

flavor: Yip Yip!
text:
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
title: Pup

flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[Subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
title: Shiro

flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
text: [Subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-No-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
title: Susanoo-No-Mikoto

flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[Credits]. Limit 1 region per server.
title: NeoTokyo Grid

flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[Credits] to do 1 brain damage.
title: Tori Hanzō

text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
title: Plan B

flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Guard

flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
text: [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Rainbow

flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
text: Gain 1[Credits] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
title: Diversified Portfolio

flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Fast Track

flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook

flavor: "Try to keep up."
text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[Credits].
title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

flavor: "Don't waste my time."
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative

flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
text: Gain 1[Credits] for each installed connection resource.
title: Calling in Favors

flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [Click].
title: Early Bird

flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Express Delivery

flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If the run is successful, you cannot access any cards.
title: Feint

flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
title: Legwork

text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
title: Planned Assault

text: +1[Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Logos

flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to play run events.
title: Public Terminal

text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [Click], [Click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.
title: Unregistered S&W '35

flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
text: [Click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
title: Window

flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
title: Alias

text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[Credits]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
title: Breach

flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[Credits] to reveal that card.
title: Bug

flavor: Catch me if you can!
text: 1[Credits]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
title: Gingerbread

flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
text: [Trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
title: Grappling Hook

flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
title: Passport

text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
title: Push Your Luck

flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
text: When your turn begins, choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[Credits].
title: Security Testing

flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
title: Theophilius Bagbiter

flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
title: Tri-maf Contact

flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say–oops, too late, here we go!"
text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
title: Mass Install

flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
text:
+1[Memory Unit]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when a program is trashed.
title: Q-Coherence Chip

text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Overmind

flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[Click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[Credits]. Otherwise, trash it.
title: Oracle May

flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
title: Donut Taganes

text: [Click][Click][Click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers. Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
title: Domestic Sleepers

flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
text: NEXT Silver gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
title: NEXT Silver

flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Lotus Field

text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
title: Mutate

flavor: Only the News You Need.
text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces.
title: Primary Transmission Dish

flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
text: The Runner must pay 1[Credits] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break a subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Midway Station Grid

flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
title: The Root

flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.
text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, trash a piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash a piece of hardware.
title: Taurus

flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
title: Mother Goddess

flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of the run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Galahad

flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
title: Bad Times

text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose a server. The Corp may rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on this server during which the Corp cannot rez ice.
title: Cyber Threat

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[Credits].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Lamprey

flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Remove all tags.
title: Paper Tripping

flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines–there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever a trace is initiated.
title: Power Tap

text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
title: Social Engineering

flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
title: Leprechaun

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Eden Shard

text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: The Foundry: Refining the Process

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [Click].
title: Enhanced Login Protocol

flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Heinlein Grid

flavor: "Binary computing  is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed code gate.
title: Encrypted Portals

flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
title: Cerebral Static

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[Credits] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.
title: Targeted Marketing

flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.
text: When the Runner encounters Information Overload, trace1– if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag. Information Overload gains "[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
title: Information Overload

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[Credits] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
title: Paywall Implementation

flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
text:
1[Credits]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[Click] or [Trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.
title: Sealed Vault

text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Eden Fragment

flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
title: Lag Time

text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
title: D4v1d

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
title: Scrubbed

flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
text:
Play only as your first [Click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[Credits] for each successful run you made during it.
title: Three Steps Ahead

flavor: What goes up must always go down.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
title: Unscheduled Maintenance

flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[Credits].
title: Cache

flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit during a run.
title: Net Celebrity

flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.
text: 3[Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
title: LLDS Energy Regulator

flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?
text:
Place 3[Credits] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
title: Ghost Runner

text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
title: IQ

flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
text: [Click],[Click],[Click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
title: Eliza's Toybox

text: [Subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ. The Runner accesses that card. If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
title: Kitsune

flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program . Limit 1 region per server.
title: Port Anson Grid

text: The Runner cannot play current events.
title: The News Now Hour

text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace2– if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
title: Manhunt

text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [Subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of the run.
title: Wendigo

text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Crisium Grid

text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
title: Chronos Project

text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.
title: Shattered Remains

flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
title: Lancelot

flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

text: 1[Credits]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[Credits]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
title: BlacKat

flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for–if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
text: [Click],[Click],[Click],[Click]: Draw 10 cards.
title: Duggar's

text: +2 [Memory Unit]. Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
title: BOX-E

text:
[Click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the play cost by 2.
title: The Supplier

text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
title: Refractor

text: The first time each turn you have no credits in your credit pool, gain 1[Credits].
title: Order of Sol

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: Access all cards from Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Hades Shard

flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
title: Rachel Beckman

text: Ashigaru gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
title: Ashigaru

flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ to gain credits equal to its rez cost.
title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Hades Fragment

text:
[Click], [Click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
title: Docklands Crackdown

text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[Credits] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
title: Inject

text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[Credits]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
title: Switchblade

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Trade-In

flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
text: +1[Memory Unit] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Astrolabe

text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
title: Angel Arena

flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
title: Bifrost Array

text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
title: Hostile Infrastructure

flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the licence agreement."
text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
title: License Acquisition

flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".
text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed barrier.
title: Superior Cyberwalls

text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
title: Merlin

text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Cerberus "Rex" H2

text:
Place 1[Credits] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[Click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.
title: Zona Sul Shipping

text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to install programs.
title: Cybsoft MacroDrive

text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
title: Cerberus "Lady" H1

text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Utopia Shard

text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you create a server.
title: Turtlebacks

text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[Credits] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Utopia Fragment

text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
title: Excalibur

flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [Click], [Trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
title: Incubator

flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.
text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[Credits], gain 1[Credits].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Ixodidae

text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
title: Code Siphon

text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
title: Collective Consciousness

text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.
title: Bribery

flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.
text: As an additional cost to access a card in a remote server, the Runner must pay 1[Credits].
title: Gagarin Deep Space: Expanding the Horizon

text:
Glenn Station can host a single card.
[Click]: Host a card from HQ facedown on Glenn Station.
[Click]: Add a card on Glenn Station to HQ.
title: Glenn Station

flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."
text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[Credits] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.
title: High-Risk Investment

flavor: Future leaders start here.
text:
If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Space Camp, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
title: Space Camp

flavor: "Traffic was murder."
text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
Do 2 meat damage.
title: Traffic Accident

text: Each piece of ice protecting this server is considered to have 1 additional advancement token on it. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Satellite Grid

flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert
text: Install Sub Boost on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice gains barrier and "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines."
title: Sub Boost

flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."
text: Trash the first operation you access each turn at no cost.
title: Edward Kim: Humanity's Hammer

flavor: No one knows what they want–least of all them.
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.
title: Itinerant Protesters

flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.
title: Human First

flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.
text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[Click],[Click],[Click],[Click],[Trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
title: Investigative Journalism

flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [Click].
title: Stim Dealer

flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[Click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
title: Virus Breeding Ground
